title: Bartow Regional Medical Center Expands to Meet Growing Community Needs
text: Bartow Regional Medical Center Expands to Meet Growing Community Needs [Owen Jenkins](https://investorshangout.com/profile/view?id=79249)Updated: 11-07-2024 05:10 PM Bartow Regional Medical Center's Expansion Initiative Bartow Regional Medical Center has embarked on an essential expansion project as the local population has surged by approximately 26% since its opening in 1999. This growth signals the necessity for increased medical services to accommodate the needs of the community, and the recent groundbreaking event marked the beginning of this important project. Community Leaders Celebrate Growth On the day of the groundbreaking ceremony, hospital staff and city leaders gathered to celebrate this significant milestone. The expansion is not only a response to current demands but is also aimed at future-proofing the facility to ensure it can meet the growing healthcare needs of the population. Hospital Leadership's Commitment Karen Kerr, the President of Bartow Regional Medical Center, expressed enthusiasm about the expansion, emphasizing the importance of moving beyond immediate capacity management. "This project is about preparing for future growth while focusing on delivering exceptional care today," she stated. Community Impact BayCare President and CEO Stephanie Conners acknowledged the hard work of the team at Bartow Regional Medical Center, stating, "The families in this area choose this facility for their healthcare needs. Investing in this culture and facility is vital to continue providing top-quality care." The community's involvement was highlighted by Bartow Mayor Trish Pfeiffer, who noted the hospital's crucial role in residents' health and well-being. Details of the Expansion Project The expansion project is estimated to cost around $110 million, aimed at increasing the hospital's capacity from 72 to 90 beds. The first phase will concentrate on enhancing the Emergency Department, adding 27 examination areas and upgrading the Sterile Processing Department. Additionally, there will be alterations to the Intensive Care Unit and improvements to the cath lab and operating room facilities. Long-Term Vision Dr. Jeremy Katzmann, the chief medical officer of Bartow Regional Medical Center, shared his excitement about the plans, stating, "This facility has served the community for over 90 years, and I am thrilled about the potential this expansion brings for our ability to serve our patients better." The completed project is expected to provide a more comprehensive healthcare experience while maintaining a focus on high-quality patient care. The Timeline Ahead Construction is set to commence soon and will unfold over a few years. "We have a remarkable team, and the ability to deliver this upgraded facility will positively impact both staff and patients alike," Kerr noted. The expansion is designed to ensure that the hospital is equipped to handle not only current patient loads but also future healthcare demands. About BayCare Health System BayCare is a leading not-for-profit healthcare organization that provides a wide range of services across its 16 hospitals and numerous outpatient facilities in the Tampa Bay and central Florida areas. Renowned as the largest provider of behavioral health and pediatric services in the region, BayCare Medical Group represents one of the most significant healthcare provider groups. Their extensive network includes urgent care locations, surgical centers, laboratories, and one of Florida's largest home care agencies. About Bartow Regional Medical Center Affiliated with BayCare, Bartow Regional Medical Center is a 72-bed acute care hospital dedicated to serving the health needs of communities in South Lakeland, Bartow, Ft. Meade, Mulberry, and the surrounding areas. The staff provides extensive emergency services backed by a team of qualified professionals ready to respond 24/7. Frequently Asked Questions What is the purpose of the expansion at Bartow Regional Medical Center? The expansion aims to enhance healthcare capacity and quality for the community as the local population increases. How much will the expansion project cost? The projected cost of the expansion is approximately $110 million. What specific areas will the expansion focus on? The initial focus will be on the Emergency Department, adding examination areas, and improvements to various hospital departments. When is construction expected to begin? Construction is planned to start shortly and is anticipated to take several years to complete. Who oversees Bartow Regional Medical Center? Bartow Regional Medical Center is part of the BayCare Health System, which provides oversight and support for operations and services.
